PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mrs. William T. Jones, 7273 Lawton Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 11, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe youngsters in their early teens, that is from 13 to 16 years of age, should be permitted to smoke cigarettes or drink alcoholic beverages?" answer reads: "No, definitely not, because they are too young and these things would be harmful to them. In fact, they are bad, regardless of who you are."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. William T. Jones wearing coat with third button undone, standing in front of light colored clapboard house
